info.title: ModelRelay API
info.description: Control-plane and inference endpoints for ModelRelay projects, tiers, customers, billing, and LLM proxying.

get.description: Returns the canonical JSON Schema (draft-07) for `workflow.v0`.
Returns the canonical JSON Schema (draft-07) for `run_event.v0` (workflow run history events).

post.description:
Used by trusted backends to mint short-lived customer-scoped bearer tokens
for data-plane access (/responses, /runs). Requires a secret API key (mr_sk_*).
The customer must already exist; use /customers endpoints to create customers first.

project_id.description: Project ID the customer belongs to

customer_id.description: Internal customer UUID (provide exactly one of customer_id or customer_external_id)

customer_external_id.description: External customer identifier (provide exactly one of customer_id or customer_external_id)

ttl_seconds.description: Requested token TTL in seconds (server may cap this)

400.description: Invalid request (missing or invalid customer selector)

post.description:
Starts an OAuth 2.0 device authorization session so constrained clients (TUIs)
can obtain a customer-scoped bearer token without running a local web server.
Requires a project-scoped API key (publishable or secret).

400.description: Invalid request (e.g., missing project-scoped API key)

post.description:
Polls a device authorization session by `device_code`. Returns a customer-scoped bearer token
once the user completes authorization in the browser.

400.description: OAuth device flow error (authorization_pending, slow_down, expired_token, invalid_grant, access_denied)

post.summary: Exchange an OIDC id_token for a customer bearer token
post.description:
Verifies a provided OIDC `id_token` using the project's configured OIDC settings,
resolves (provider, subject) to a customer via customer_identities, and returns
a short-lived customer-scoped bearer token for data-plane access.

id_token.description: OIDC id_token JWT to verify and exchange

project_id.description: Optional; must match the API key's project_id if provided

409.description: Identity already linked to a different customer

post.summary: Link an end-user identity to a customer by email
post.description:
Used when a customer subscribes via Stripe Checkout (email only) and later authenticates to the app.
Links (provider, subject) to the existing customer record found by email.

provider.description: Identity provider (must match project's enabled providers)

subject.description: OAuth/OIDC subject claim from the identity provider

409.description: Identity already linked to a different customer

get.description:
Returns the current customer associated with the provided customer-scoped bearer token.
Includes the customer's tier and allowed models.

Returns customer-visible usage metrics for the current billing window.
Includes request/token counts and (for paid tiers) remaining subscription credits.
Does not include any developer-private budgets (e.g., internal tier spend caps).

Returns customer-visible subscription details for the authenticated customer bearer token.
Includes tier name and subscription price; does not include developer-private usage cost accounting.
Returns all active models with rich metadata for building model selectors.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Filter results to a specific provider

parameters.name: capability
parameters.description: Filter results to models that support a capability

post.description: Accepts subscription lifecycle events from Stripe.

get.summary: List projects for the authenticated owner

post.summary: Create a response via the provider-agnostic API

post.description: Starts a run for a `workflow.v0` spec and returns a `run_id`. Auth matches `/responses` (API key or frontend bearer token). Session owner tokens from `/auth/login` are not accepted.

get.description: Returns a derived snapshot state for the run (folded from event history + artifacts), including outputs and an aggregated cost summary when available.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: When false, returns currently available events then closes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to send before closing.

get.description: Streams an append-only, totally ordered history for the run. The wire format is negotiated via `Accept`: NDJSON (`application/x-ndjson`) or Server-Sent Events (`text/event-stream`). Each line/event is a `run_event.v0` envelope; see `/schemas/run_event_v0.schema.json` for the canonical schema.

model_display_name.description: Human-friendly model name resolved from pricing (e.g., 'GPT-4o Mini')

description.description: Human-friendly description of what the model is good at

capabilities.description: Workflow-critical capability flags for the model

context_window.description: Maximum supported context window in tokens (if known)

input_price_per_million_cents.description: Input token price in cents per million (e.g., 300 = $3.00/1M tokens)

output_price_per_million_cents.description: Output token price in cents per million (e.g., 1500 = $15.00/1M tokens)

is_default.description: Whether this is the default model for the tier

spend_limit_cents.description: Monthly spend limit in cents (e.g., 2000 = $20/month). Must be non-negative.

stripe_price_id.description: Stripe price ID for this tier

trial_days.description: Number of trial days for new subscriptions

spend_limit_cents.description: Monthly spend limit in cents (e.g., 2000 = $20/month). Must be non-negative.

price_amount_cents.description: Subscription price amount in cents (paid tiers)

trial_days.description: Number of trial days for new subscriptions (paid tiers)

spend_limit_cents.description: Monthly spend limit in cents (e.g., 2000 = $20/month). Must be non-negative.

price_amount_cents.description: Subscription price amount in cents (paid tiers)

trial_days.description: Number of trial days for new subscriptions (paid tiers)

external_id.description: External customer identifier from your system

current_period_start.description: Start of the current billing period

current_period_end.description: End of the current billing period

credits_used_cents.description: Credits used in this day bucket (only for paid tiers)

CustomerMeUsage.description: Customer-visible usage metrics for the current billing window.

window_start.description: Start of the current billing window

window_end.description: End of the current billing window

credits_granted_cents.description: Credits granted for this billing window (only for paid tiers)

credits_used_cents.description: Credits used so far in this billing window (only for paid tiers)

credits_remaining_cents.description: Credits remaining in this billing window (only for paid tiers)

percentage_used.description: Percentage of granted credits used (only for paid tiers)

CustomerMeSubscription.description: Customer-visible subscription details for the current tier.

price_amount_cents.description: Subscription price amount in cents (omitted for free tiers)

current_period_start.description: Start of the current billing period

current_period_end.description: End of the current billing period

external_id.description: External customer identifier from your system

stop_reason.description: Why generation stopped (stop, max_tokens, tool_use, etc.)

detail.description: Raw error details from the provider

WorkflowSpecV0.description: A `workflow.v0` spec. The canonical JSON Schema is available at `/schemas/workflow_v0.schema.json`.

detail.description: Raw error details from the provider

Usage.description: Token usage statistics. All fields default to 0 if not present.

project_id.description: Project the token is scoped to

user_code.description: Human-enterable code shown to the user

verification_uri.description: URL where the user enters the code and completes authorization

verification_uri_complete.description: Convenience URL that pre-fills the user_code (optional)

expires_in.description: Seconds until the device code expires

interval.description: Updated recommended polling interval in seconds (when error is slow_down)

active.description: Whether the subscription is currently active

current_period_start.description: Start of the current billing period

current_period_end.description: End of the current billing period

RunsPendingToolsResponse.description: Response containing pending tool calls for a workflow run.

RunsPendingToolsNodeV0.description: A node with pending tool calls.

step.description: The step number within the node execution

RunsPendingToolCallV0.description: A pending tool call waiting for a result.

tool_call_id.description: Unique identifier for this tool call

name.description: Name of the tool to be called

arguments.description: JSON-encoded arguments for the tool call

NDJSONStreamEvent.description:
Events sent during streaming responses (application/x-ndjson).
Each line is a JSON object with an "event" field indicating the type.

ToolCallDelta.description: Incremental tool call data during streaming

NodeId.description: Workflow node identifier. Must start with a lowercase letter and contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores.

RunId.description: Unique identifier for a workflow run.

RequestId.description: Unique identifier for an LLM request within a workflow run.

PlanHash.description: SHA-256 hash of the compiled workflow plan (64 hex characters).

TierCode.description: Tier code identifier (e.g., free, pro, enterprise).
